member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.AccessControlManager
member.summary: Access control manager. Dictates which connections are permitted or denied.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.AccessControlManager.Blacklist
member.summary: Matcher to match blacklisted addresses.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.AccessControlManager.Whitelist
member.summary: Matcher to match whitelisted addresses.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.AccessControlManager.Mode
member.summary: Access control mode, either DefaultPermit or DefaultDeny. DefaultPermit: allow everything, except for those explicitly blacklisted. DefaultDeny: deny everything, except for those explicitly whitelisted.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.AccessControlManager.#ctor(WatsonWebserver.AccessControlMode)
member.summary: Instantiate the object.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.AccessControlManager.Permit(System.String)
member.summary: Permit or deny a request based on IP address. When operating in 'default deny', only white listed entries are permitted. When operating in 'default permit', everything is allowed unless explicitly blacklisted.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.AccessControlMode
member.summary: Access control mode of operation.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.AccessControlMode.DefaultPermit
member.summary: Permit requests from any endpoint by default.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.AccessControlMode.DefaultDeny
member.summary: Deny requests from any endpoint by default.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.Chunk
member.summary: A chunk of data, used when reading from a request where the Transfer-Encoding header includes 'chunked'.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.Chunk.Length
member.summary: Length of the data.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.Chunk.Data
member.summary: Data.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.Chunk.Metadata
member.summary: Any additional metadata that appears on the length line after the length hex value and semicolon.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.Chunk.IsFinalChunk
member.summary: Indicates whether or not this is the final chunk, i.e. the chunk length received was zero.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.ContentRoute
member.summary: Assign a method handler for when requests are received matching the supplied method and path.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.ContentRoute.Path
member.summary: The pattern against which the raw URL should be matched.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.ContentRoute.IsDirectory
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the path specifies a directory. If so, any matching URL will be handled by the specified handler.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.ContentRoute.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a new route object.
member.param: The pattern against which the raw URL should be matched.
Indicates whether or not the path specifies a directory. If so, any matching URL will be handled by the specified handler.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.ContentRouteManager
member.summary: Content route manager. Content routes are used for GET and HEAD requests to specific files or entire directories.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.ContentRouteManager.BaseDirectory
member.summary: Base directory for files and directories accessible via content routes.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.ContentRouteManager.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiate the object.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.ContentRouteManager.Add(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add a route.
member.param: True if the path represents a directory.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.ContentRouteManager.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Remove a route.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.ContentRouteManager.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve a content route.
member.returns: ContentRoute if the route exists, otherwise null.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.ContentRouteManager.Exists(System.String)
member.summary: Check if a content route exists.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.ContentRouteProcessor
member.summary: Content route processor. Handles GET and HEAD requests to content routes for files and directories.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.ContentRouteProcessor.ContentFileMode
member.summary: The FileMode value to use when accessing files within a content route via a FileStream. Default is FileMode.Open.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.ContentRouteProcessor.ContentFileAccess
member.summary: The FileAccess value to use when accessing files within a content route via a FileStream. Default is FileAccess.Read.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.ContentRouteProcessor.ContentFileShare
member.summary: The FileShare value to use when accessing files within a content route via a FileStream. Default is FileShare.Read.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.DynamicRoute
member.summary: Assign a method handler for when requests are received matching the supplied method and path regex.

member.summary: The HTTP method, i.e. GET, PUT, POST, DELETE, etc.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.DynamicRoute.Path
member.summary: The pattern against which the raw URL should be matched.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.DynamicRoute.Handler
member.summary: The handler for the dynamic route.

member.summary: Create a new route object.
member.param: The HTTP method, i.e. GET, PUT, POST, DELETE, etc.
The pattern against which the raw URL should be matched.
The method that should be called to handle the request.

member.summary: Dynamic route manager. Dynamic routes are used for requests using any HTTP method to any path that can be matched by regular expression.

member.summary: Instantiate the object.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.EventCallbacks
member.summary: Callbacks/actions to use when various events are encountered.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.EventCallbacks.ConnectionReceived
member.summary: Callback/action to call when a connection is received. string: IP address of the client. int: Source TCP port of the client.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.EventCallbacks.RequestReceived
member.summary: Callback/action to call when a request is received. string: IP address of the client. int: Source TCP port of the client. string: HTTP method. string: Full URL.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.EventCallbacks.AccessControlDenied
member.summary: Callback/action to call when a request is denied due to access control. string: IP address of the client. int: Source TCP port of the client. string: HTTP method. string: Full URL.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.EventCallbacks.RequestorDisconnected
member.summary: Callback/action to call when a requestor disconnected unexpectedly. string: IP address of the client. int: Source TCP port of the client. string: HTTP method. string Full URL.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.EventCallbacks.ResponseSent
member.summary: Callback/action to call when a response is sent. string: IP address of the client. int: Source TCP port of the client. string: HTTP method. string: Full URL. int: Response status code. double: Number of milliseconds.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.EventCallbacks.ExceptionEncountered
member.summary: Callback/action to call when an exception is encountered. string: IP address of the client. int: Source TCP port of the client. Exception: Exception encountered.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.EventCallbacks.ServerStopped
member.summary: Callback/action to call when the server is stopped.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.EventCallbacks.ServerDisposed
member.summary: Callback/action to call when the server is disposed.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.EventCallbacks.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiate the object.

member.summary: UTC timestamp from when the request was received.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.ThreadId
member.summary: Thread ID on which the request exists.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.ProtocolVersion
member.summary: The protocol and version.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.SourceIp
member.summary: IP address of the requestor (client).

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.SourcePort
member.summary: TCP port from which the request originated on the requestor (client).

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.DestIp
member.summary: IP address of the recipient (server).

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.DestPort
member.summary: TCP port on which the request was received by the recipient (server).

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.DestHostname
member.summary: The destination hostname as found in the request line, if present.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.DestHostPort
member.summary: The destination host port as found in the request line, if present.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.Keepalive
member.summary: Specifies whether or not the client requested HTTP keepalives.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.Method
member.summary: The HTTP method used in the request.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.ChunkedTransfer
member.summary: Indicates whether or not chunked transfer encoding was detected.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.Gzip
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the payload has been gzip compressed.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.Deflate
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the payload has been deflate compressed.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.FullUrl
member.summary: The full URL as sent by the requestor (client).

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.RawUrlWithQuery
member.summary: The raw (relative) URL with the querystring attached.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.RawUrlWithoutQuery
member.summary: The raw (relative) URL without the querystring attached.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.RawUrlEntries
member.summary: List of items found in the raw URL.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.Querystring
member.summary: The querystring attached to the URL.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.QuerystringEntries
member.summary: Dictionary containing key-value pairs from items found in the querystring.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.Useragent
member.summary: The useragent specified in the request.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.ContentLength
member.summary: The number of bytes in the request body.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.ContentType
member.summary: The content type as specified by the requestor (client).

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.Headers
member.summary: The headers found in the request.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.Data
member.summary: The stream from which to read the request body sent by the requestor (client).

member.summary: The original HttpListenerContext from which the HttpRequest was constructed.

member.summary: Instantiate the object using a generic stream.

member.summary: Instantiate the object using a TCP client.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.ToString
member.summary: Retrieve a string-formatted, human-readable copy of the HttpRequest instance.
member.returns: String-formatted, human-readable copy of the HttpRequest instance.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.RetrieveHeaderValue(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve a specified header value from either the headers or the querystring (case insensitive).

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.ReadChunk
member.summary: For chunked transfer-encoded requests, read the next chunk.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.DataAsBytes
member.summary: Read the data stream fully and retrieve the byte data contained within. Note: if you use this method, you will not be able to read from the data stream afterward.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.DataAsString
member.summary: Read the data stream fully and retrieve the string data contained within. Note: if you use this method, you will not be able to read from the data stream afterward.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpRequest.DataAsJsonObject``1
member.summary: Read the data stream fully and convert the data to the object type specified using JSON deserialization. Note: if you use this method, you will not be able to read from the data stream afterward.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse
member.summary: Response to an HTTP request.

member.summary: The HTTP status code to return to the requestor (client).

member.summary: The HTTP status description to return to the requestor (client).

member.summary: User-supplied headers to include in the response.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.ContentType
member.summary: User-supplied content-type to include in the response.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.ContentLength
member.summary: The length of the supplied response data.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.ChunkedTransfer
member.summary: Indicates whether or not chunked transfer encoding should be indicated in the response.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiate the object.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.ToString
member.summary: Retrieve a string-formatted, human-readable copy of the HttpResponse instance.
member.returns: String-formatted, human-readable copy of the HttpResponse instance.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.Send
member.summary: Send headers and no data to the requestor and terminate the connection.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.Send(System.Int64)
member.summary: Send headers with a specified content length and no data to the requestor and terminate the connection. Useful for HEAD requests where the content length must be set.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.Send(System.String)
member.summary: Send headers and data to the requestor and terminate the connection.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.Send(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Send headers and data to the requestor and terminate the connection.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.Send(System.Int64,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Send headers and data to the requestor and terminate.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.SendChunk(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Send headers (if not already sent) and a chunk of data using chunked transfer-encoding, and keep the connection in-tact.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.HttpResponse.SendFinalChunk(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Send headers (if not already sent) and the final chunk of data using chunked transfer-encoding and terminate the connection.

member.summary: Human-readable version of the object.

member.name: T:WatsonWebserver.Server
member.summary: Watson webserver.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Server.IsListening
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the server is listening.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Server.StreamReadBufferSize
member.summary: Indicate the buffer size to use when reading from a stream to send data to a requestor.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.Server.OptionsRoute
member.summary: Function to call when an OPTIONS request is received. Often used to handle CORS. Leave as 'null' to use the default OPTIONS handler.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.Server.PreRoutingHandler
member.summary: Function to call prior to routing. Return 'true' if the connection should be terminated. Return 'false' to allow the connection to continue routing.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.Server.DynamicRoutes
member.summary: Dynamic routes; i.e. routes with regex matching and any HTTP method.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.Server.StaticRoutes
member.summary: Static routes; i.e. routes with explicit matching and any HTTP method.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.Server.ContentRoutes
member.summary: Content routes; i.e. routes to specific files or folders for GET and HEAD requests.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.Server.AccessControl
member.summary: Access control manager, i.e. default mode of operation, white list, and black list.

member.name: F:WatsonWebserver.Server.Events
member.summary: Set specific actions/callbacks to use when events are raised.

member.name: P:WatsonWebserver.Server.Stats
member.summary: Watson webserver statistics.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.Server.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Func{WatsonWebserver.HttpContext,System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the Watson Webserver.
member.param: Hostname or IP address on which to listen.
TCP port on which to listen.
Specify whether or not SSL should be used (HTTPS).
Method used when a request is received and no matching routes are found. Commonly used as the 404 handler when routes are used.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.Server.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Func{WatsonWebserver.HttpContext,System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the Watson Webserver.
member.param: Hostnames or IP addresses on which to listen. Note: multiple listener endpoints is not supported on all platforms.
TCP port on which to listen.
Specify whether or not SSL should be used (HTTPS).
Method used when a request is received and no matching routes are found. Commonly used as the 404 handler when routes are used.

member.name: M:WatsonWebserver.Server.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Func{WatsonWebserver.HttpContext,System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the Watson Webserver.
member.param: URIs on which to listen. URIs should be of the form: http://[hostname]:[port]/[url] Note: multiple listener endpoints is not supported on all platforms.
Method used when a request is received and no matching routes are found. Commonly used as the 404 handler when routes are used.

member.summary: Tear down the server and dispose of background workers.
